questions.question: What is a galaxy?

options.text: A collection of billions of stars and interstellar matter

questions.answer: A collection of billions of stars and interstellar matter

questions.question: Our galaxy is called:
questions.answer: Milky Way (Mandakini)

questions.question: Which type of galaxy is the Milky Way?
questions.answer: Spiral

questions.question: Which is the nearest star to Earth?
questions.answer: Sun

questions.question: Stars are made up of:
questions.answer: Hot gases

questions.question: Main fuel of the Sun is:
questions.answer: Hydrogen

questions.question: Energy in stars is produced due to:
questions.answer: Nuclear fusion

questions.question: What are interstellar clouds made of?
questions.answer: Gas and dust

questions.question: Stars are born from:
questions.answer: Interstellar clouds

questions.question: A light year is a unit of:
questions.answer: Distance

questions.question: Which force keeps stars stable?

options.text: Balance of gravity and gas pressure

questions.answer: Balance of gravity and gas pressure

questions.question: When fuel in a star decreases, the star:
questions.answer: Starts evolving

questions.question: Sun will become a red giant after about:
questions.answer: 4–5 billion years

questions.question: Which stage comes after red giant for low mass stars?
questions.answer: White dwarf

questions.question: White dwarf has size similar to:
questions.answer: Earth

questions.question: Stars with mass between 8–25 times Sun end as:
questions.answer: Neutron star

questions.question: Explosion of massive star is called:
questions.answer: Supernova

questions.question: Neutron stars are made mainly of:
questions.answer: Neutrons

questions.question: Stars with mass more than 25 times Sun become:
questions.answer: Black hole

questions.question: In black hole, even light cannot:
questions.answer: Escape

questions.question: Mass of stars is measured in units of:
questions.answer: Sun’s mass

questions.question: Alpha Centauri is:
questions.answer: Nearest star to Sun

questions.question: Red giant stars look red because:
questions.answer: They have lower temperature

questions.question: Which fuel burns after hydrogen in stars?
questions.answer: Helium

questions.question: Life cycle of star depends mainly on:
questions.answer: Initial mass

questions.question: Which force pulls gas inward in stars?
questions.answer: Gravitational

questions.question: Which pressure pushes gas outward in stars?
questions.answer: Gas pressure

questions.question: Sun’s age is about:
questions.answer: 4.5 billion years

questions.question: Cluster of stars forms from:
questions.answer: Single interstellar cloud

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an end stage of star?
questions.answer: Planet

questions.question: Gas pressure in stars depends on:
questions.answer: Density and temperature

questions.question: Sun is called ordinary star because:

options.text: Many stars have similar or greater mass

questions.answer: Many stars have similar or greater mass

questions.question: Which element forms 72% of Sun’s mass?
questions.answer: Hydrogen

questions.question: Rotation period of Milky Way is about:
questions.answer: 2 × 10⁸ years

questions.question: Stars evolve because of:
questions.answer: Burning of fuel

questions.question: After hydrogen, next fuel in Sun will be:
questions.answer: Helium

questions.question: Which star has highest density?
questions.answer: Neutron star

questions.question: Which stage comes before supernova?
questions.answer: Supergiant

questions.question: Which stars evolve faster?
questions.answer: High mass stars

questions.question: Which is correct order for low mass stars?
questions.answer: Red giant → White dwarf

questions.question: Which pressure balances gravity in white dwarf?
questions.answer: Electron pressure

questions.question: Which pressure balances gravity in neutron stars?
questions.answer: Neutron pressure

questions.question: Which stage is final for Sun?
questions.answer: White dwarf

questions.question: Which star explosion was seen in year 1054?
questions.answer: Supernova

questions.question: Which stars become black holes?
questions.answer: Very high mass stars

questions.question: What happens to outer layer of star in supernova?
questions.answer: It is thrown out

questions.question: Which statement is true?

options.text: End stage depends on initial mass

questions.answer: End stage depends on initial mass

questions.question: Which stage shows largest size of star?
questions.answer: Supergiant

questions.question: Which element is produced from hydrogen fusion?
questions.answer: Helium

questions.question: Which object has strongest gravity?
questions.answer: Black hole

questions.question: What is a star?
questions.answer: A star is a huge ball of hot glowing gases that produces its own light and heat.

questions.question: What is a galaxy?
questions.answer: A galaxy is a large group of billions of stars, gas and dust held together by gravity.

questions.question: Name our galaxy.
questions.answer: Our galaxy is called the Milky Way or Mandakini.

questions.question: What type of galaxy is the Milky Way?
questions.answer: It is a spiral galaxy.

questions.question: Which is the nearest star to Earth?
questions.answer: The Sun is the nearest star to Earth.

questions.question: What is the main fuel of the Sun?
questions.answer: Hydrogen is the main fuel of the Sun.

questions.question: How is energy produced in stars?
questions.answer: Energy is produced by nuclear fusion of hydrogen into helium.

questions.question: What are interstellar clouds?
questions.answer: They are clouds of gas and dust found between stars.

questions.question: From what are stars formed?
questions.answer: Stars are formed from interstellar clouds of gas and dust.

questions.question: What is meant by stability of a star?
questions.answer: Stability is the balance between gravity and outward gas pressure in a star.

questions.question: Which force pulls material inward in a star?
questions.answer: Gravitational force pulls material inward.

questions.question: Which pressure pushes material outward in a star?
questions.answer: Gas pressure produced by nuclear reactions pushes outward.

questions.question: What happens when hydrogen fuel starts decreasing in a star?
questions.answer: The star starts evolving into later stages.

questions.question: What is a red giant?
questions.answer: A red giant is a star that has expanded and cooled after using most of its hydrogen fuel.

questions.question: Why does a red giant look red?
questions.answer: Because its surface temperature becomes lower.

questions.question: What happens after red giant stage for low-mass stars?
questions.answer: They shrink and form white dwarf stars.

questions.question: What is a white dwarf?
questions.answer: A white dwarf is a small, very dense and hot leftover core of a star.

questions.question: What is the size of a white dwarf compared to Earth?
questions.answer: It is roughly the size of Earth.

questions.question: What happens to white dwarf after long time?
questions.answer: It cools down and becomes dark.

questions.question: What is a supernova?
questions.answer: A supernova is a powerful explosion of a massive star.

questions.question: When does supernova occur?
questions.answer: When the core of a massive star collapses after fuel is exhausted.

questions.question: What remains after a supernova?
questions.answer: Neutron star or black hole may remain.

questions.question: What is a neutron star?
questions.answer: A very dense star made mainly of neutrons formed after supernova.

questions.question: How dense is a neutron star?
questions.answer: It is extremely dense; a small amount weighs millions of tons.

questions.question: What is a black hole?
questions.answer: A region in space with extremely strong gravity where even light cannot escape.

questions.question: How is a black hole formed?
questions.answer: When the core of a very massive star collapses completely after supernova.

questions.question: Why cannot light escape from black hole?
questions.answer: Because gravitational pull is extremely strong.

questions.question: What is light year?
questions.answer: Distance travelled by light in one year.

questions.question: Why is light year used in astronomy?
questions.answer: Because distances in space are very large.

questions.question: What is Alpha Centauri?
questions.answer: The nearest star system to the Sun.

questions.question: On what does life cycle of star depend?
questions.answer: It depends mainly on the initial mass of the star.

questions.question: Which stars live longer, massive or small?
questions.answer: Small mass stars live longer.

questions.question: Why do massive stars die faster?
questions.answer: Because they burn fuel at a faster rate.

questions.question: What is a star cluster?
questions.answer: A group of stars formed from the same interstellar cloud.

questions.question: Why do stars shine?
questions.answer: Due to continuous nuclear fusion in their core.

questions.question: What is fusion?
questions.answer: Joining of small nuclei to form a larger nucleus with energy release.

questions.question: Which element forms most of Sun’s mass?
questions.answer: Hydrogen.

questions.question: What happens after helium burning in massive stars?
questions.answer: Heavier elements are formed until iron.

questions.question: Why fusion stops after iron formation?
questions.answer: Because fusion of iron does not release energy.

questions.question: What is supergiant?
questions.answer: A very large and bright star formed from massive stars.

questions.question: Which stars become supergiants?
questions.answer: High mass stars.

questions.question: What pressure supports white dwarf against gravity?
questions.answer: Electron pressure.

questions.question: What pressure supports neutron stars?
questions.answer: Neutron pressure.

questions.question: What is core of a star?
questions.answer: The central region where nuclear fusion takes place.

questions.question: What is temperature of Sun’s core?
questions.answer: About 15 million degree Celsius.

questions.question: What is surface temperature of Sun?
questions.answer: About 6000 degree Celsius.

questions.question: Why stars twinkle?
questions.answer: Due to atmospheric refraction of light.

questions.question: Why planets do not twinkle?
questions.answer: Because they are closer and appear as disks.

questions.question: What is brightness of star?
questions.answer: Amount of light received from star.

questions.question: What is apparent brightness?
questions.answer: Brightness as seen from Earth.

questions.question: What is absolute brightness?
questions.answer: Actual brightness of a star at fixed distance.

questions.question: Why do some stars look brighter?
questions.answer: Because they are closer or more luminous.

questions.question: What is luminosity?
questions.answer: Total energy emitted by a star per second.

questions.question: Which stars are called ordinary stars?
questions.answer: Stars like the Sun with average mass and size.

questions.question: What is nebula?
questions.answer: Another name for interstellar cloud of gas and dust.

questions.question: Why nebula is important?
questions.answer: Because new stars are born from nebula.

questions.question: What is protostar?
questions.answer: Early stage of star formation before fusion begins.

questions.question: When does a protostar become a star?
questions.answer: When nuclear fusion starts in its core.

questions.question: Why does star expand into red giant?
questions.answer: Due to increased fusion and outward pressure.

questions.question: Why do stars eventually die?
questions.answer: Because their nuclear fuel gets exhausted.

questions.question: What happens to outer layers in supernova?
questions.answer: They are thrown into space.

questions.question: What elements are spread by supernova?
questions.answer: Heavy elements like iron and gold.

questions.question: Why supernova is important for universe?
questions.answer: It spreads heavy elements needed for planet formation.

questions.question: What is stellar evolution?
questions.answer: Changes in star from birth to death.

questions.question: What is mass of Sun compared to Earth?
questions.answer: Sun is about 3,30,000 times heavier than Earth.

questions.question: Why Sun is not a giant star?
questions.answer: Because its mass is moderate.

questions.question: What will Sun become in future?
questions.answer: Red giant and finally white dwarf.

questions.question: After how many years Sun will become red giant?
questions.answer: After about 4–5 billion years.

questions.question: Will Earth survive Sun’s red giant stage?
questions.answer: Earth may be destroyed or severely affected.

questions.question: What is gravitational collapse?
questions.answer: Collapse of star due to strong gravity when pressure fails.

questions.question: Which stars produce neutron stars?
questions.answer: Stars with mass about 8–25 times that of Sun.

questions.question: Which stars form black holes?
questions.answer: Stars with mass more than about 25 times Sun.

questions.question: What is escape velocity?
questions.answer: Minimum speed needed to escape gravity of object.

questions.question: Why escape velocity is highest for black hole?
questions.answer: Because gravity is extremely strong.

questions.question: What is event horizon?
questions.answer: Boundary of black hole beyond which nothing can escape.

questions.question: Can black holes be seen directly?
questions.answer: No, they are detected by their effects on nearby objects.

questions.question: What happens near black hole?
questions.answer: Matter is pulled in and heated strongly.

questions.question: What is cosmic dust?
questions.answer: Tiny solid particles present in space.

questions.question: Why universe has many elements?
questions.answer: Because stars and supernova create and spread them.

questions.question: What is astrophysics?
questions.answer: Study of physical properties of stars and space.

questions.question: Why is Sun important for life?
questions.answer: It provides heat and light energy.

questions.question: What is solar system?
questions.answer: Sun and all objects orbiting around it.

questions.question: Why planets do not produce energy like stars?
questions.answer: Because they do not have nuclear fusion.

questions.question: What is gravitational binding?
questions.answer: Holding objects together by gravity.

questions.question: Why galaxies rotate?
questions.answer: Due to gravitational interaction among stars.

questions.question: What is age of Milky Way?
questions.answer: About 13 billion years.

questions.question: What is cosmic radiation?
questions.answer: High energy radiation coming from space.

questions.question: Why study stars?
questions.answer: To understand origin and future of universe.

questions.question: What is stellar mass unit?
questions.answer: Mass of the Sun is used as unit.

questions.question: Why do astronomers use telescopes?
questions.answer: To observe distant stars and galaxies.

questions.question: What is space vacuum?
questions.answer: Region with very little matter.

questions.question: Can sound travel in space?
questions.answer: No, because there is no medium.

questions.question: What is cosmic cycle?
questions.answer: Continuous formation and destruction of stars.

questions.question: What happens to elements after star dies?
questions.answer: They become part of new stars and planets.

questions.question: Why is Sun called medium mass star?
questions.answer: Because its mass is neither very small nor very large.

questions.question: What is cosmic dust role in star formation?
questions.answer: It helps gas to cool and collapse.

questions.question: Why star formation is slow process?
questions.answer: Because gravitational collapse takes long time.

questions.question: What is stellar remnant?
questions.answer: Leftover core after star’s death.

questions.question: Why universe keeps evolving?
questions.answer: Because stars continuously form and die.

questions.question: Why study life cycle of stars in school?
questions.answer: To understand origin of elements and universe.
